availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Beyerbach (Jefferson County, Kentucky, student and tinner)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, student and tinner. Kentucky native. Son of Philip Beyerbach and Juliana "Julia" Beyerbach. Father of George Beyerbach. Student in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Tinner in Jefferson County in 1860. Convicted of maliciously cutting Landsrath in Jefferson County in September 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 449B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 3, p. 670-71.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 473A-B.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #7007126, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 161.
KYR-0001-004-0445.
KYR-0001-004-0448.
